greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of tilings of a 2k X n rectangle using 2n k-ominoes of shape I; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..100, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local d, k; d:= nops(l)/2;
else for k while l[k]>0 do od;
mathematica: b[n_, l_List] := b[n, l] = Module[{d = Length[l]/2, k}, Which[n == 0, 1, Min[l] > 0 , Function[{m}, b[n-m, l-m]][Min[l]], True, For[k=1, l[[k]] > 0, k++]; If[n<d, 0, b[n, ReplacePart[l, k -> d]]] + If[d == 1 || k > d+1 || Max[l[[k ;; k+d-1]]] > 0, 0, b[n, Join[l[[1 ;; k-1]], Array[1&, d], l[[k+d ;; 2*d]]]]]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, 1, b[n, Array[0&, 2k]]]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 30 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 26 2014
